data.chText: 道德原则；行为准则；规范
data.enText: a moral rule or a strong belief that influences your actions

data.chText: 他很有道德。
data.enText: He has high moral principles.

data.chText: 我绝不为此事撒谎；那是违背我的原则的。
data.enText: I refuse to lie about it; it's against my principles .

data.chText: 要恪守自己的原则，告诉他你绝不会干的。
data.enText: Stick to your principles and tell him you won't do it.

data.chText: 她不要家人帮忙，对她来说这是个原则问题。
data.enText: She refuses to allow her family to help her as a matter of principle .

data.chText: 他根据自己的信条，不投资军火工业。
data.enText: He doesn't invest in the arms industry on principle .

data.chText: 法则；原则；原理
data.enText: a law, a rule or a theory that sth is based on

data.chText: 报告写作的理论与实践
data.enText: the principles and practice of writing reports

data.chText: 其中的原理十分简单。
data.enText: The principle behind it is very simple.

data.chText: 团队合作有三个基本原则。
data.enText: There are three fundamental principles of teamwork.

data.chText: 一直谈这些细节不会有结果的；我们必须回到根本原则上来。
data.enText: Discussing all these details will get us nowhere; we must get back to first principles (= the most basic rules) .

data.chText: 观念；（行动、思想的）理由，信条
data.enText: a belief that is accepted as a reason for acting or thinking in a particular way

data.chText: 所有儿童都应该能享受免费教育的观念
data.enText: the principle that free education should be available for all children

data.chText: 定律；工作原理
data.enText: a general or scientific law that explains how sth works or why sth happens

data.chText: 热气上升的定律
data.enText: the principle that heat rises
in principle

data.chText: 原则上；理论上
data.enText: if something can be done in principle , there is no good reason why it should not be done although it has not yet been done and there may be some difficulties

data.chText: 原则上，总会有一天，凡是人能做的事，机器就能做。
data.enText: In principle there is nothing that a human can do that a machine might not be able to do one day.

data.chText: 大体上；基本上
data.enText: in general but not in detail

data.chText: 他们已基本同意了这项提议，但我们还得磋商各项条款。
data.enText: They have agreed to the proposal in principle but we still have to negotiate the terms.

simple_means.memory_skill: prin 主要的 + cip 抓 + le 做某种动作时所使用的东西 → 握住主要〔原则〕→ 原则

ex.chText: 他只不过是能说会道，其实，他根本就不懂什么是企业管理的基本原理。
ex.enText: He just has the gift of gab, and in fact, knows nothing about the basic principles of business management.

ex.chText: 总的原则是，所有的学生都应该受到公平对待。
ex.enText: The general principle is that all the students should be equally treated.

synonyms.bx: 指某事物所依据的思想或理论。

ex.chText: 请首先阅读印刷生产基础导论。
ex.enText: Please first read the introduction on the fundamentals of print production.

ex.chText: 想要参加这个项目的学生需要了解现代流体力学的基本原理。
ex.enText: Students who want to take part in this project should know the fundamentals of modern fluid mechanics.

synonyms.bx: 指某事物所依托的最重要的观念、规律等。

ex.chText: 你是如何理解供求规律的？
ex.enText: What is your understanding of the law of supply and demand?

ex.chText: 你能给我举几个说明万有引力定律的例子吗？
ex.enText: Can you give me several examples to illustrate the law of gravity?

synonyms.bx: 指自然界或人类社会恒常发生的事或对此进行的描述。

ex.chText: 毕达哥拉斯定理可以用一个简短的等式表示为：a2+b2=c2。
ex.enText: The Pythagorean theorem can be written in one short equation: a2 + b2 = c2.

synonyms.bx: 通常用于科技英语，多指可以得到证明的数学定理。

data.enText: in principle

data.chText: 原则上；理论上
data.enText: if something can be done in principle , there is no good reason why it should not be done although it has not yet been done and there may be some difficulties

data.chText: 原则上，总会有一天，凡是人能做的事，机器就能做。
data.enText: In principle there is nothing that a human can do that a machine might not be able to do one day.

data.chText: 大体上；基本上
data.enText: in general but not in detail

data.chText: 他们已基本同意了这项提议，但我们还得磋商各项条款。
data.enText: They have agreed to the proposal in principle but we still have to negotiate the terms.

tr: (law) an explanation of the fundamental reasons (especially an explanation of the working of some device in terms of laws of nature)
a basic truth or law or assumption
a rule or law concerning a natural phenomenon or the function of a complex system
example: the principle of the conservation of mass
the right-hand rule for inductive fields

tr: a basic generalization that is accepted as true and that can be used as a basis for reasoning or conduct
example: their principles of composition characterized all their works

tr: a rule or standard especially of good behavior
example: he will not violate his principles

value.def: A principle is a general belief that you have about the way you should behave, which influences your behaviour.

example.ex: Buck never allowed himself to be bullied into doing anything that went against his principles...
example.tran: 巴克从来不会因为受到威胁而做违背自己原则的事情。

example.ex: It's not just a matter of principle.
example.tran: 这不仅仅是原则的问题。

gramarinfo.label: usu poss N, adj N, prep N

value.tran: 道德原则；行为准则；操守

value.def: The principles of a particular theory or philosophy are its basic rules or laws.

example.ex: ...a violation of the basic principles of Marxism...
example.tran: 违背马克思主义的基本原则

example.ex: The doctrine was based on three fundamental principles.
example.tran: 这个学说建立在三条基本原理之上。

value.def: Scientific principles are general scientific laws which explain how something happens or works.

example.ex: These people lack all understanding of  scientific principles.
example.tran: 这些人对科学原理一窍不通。

value.def: If you agree with something in principle, you agree in general terms to the idea of it, although you do not yet know the details or know if it will be possible.

example.ex: I agree with it in principle but I doubt if it will happen in practice.
example.tran: 我大体上同意这一点，但是怀疑它是否能够付诸实践。

value.def: If something is possible in principle, there is no known reason why it should not happen, even though it has not happened before.

example.ex: Even assuming this to be in principle possible, it will not be achieved soon.
example.tran: 即使假定这在理论上行得通，它也不可能于短期内实现。

value.def: If you refuse to do something on principle, you refuse to do it because of a particular belief that you have.

example.ex: He would vote against it on principle...
example.tran: 他会根据原则投反对票。

example.ex: His father, on principle, did not like to hear requests for money.
example.tran: 从原则上来说，他父亲不喜欢别人借钱。

gramarinfo.label: usu with brd-neg, PHR after v

trans: 原理；工作原理；结构原理；产品工作原理；工作原则
根据...原则；按照…的原则；根据...的原则
原则上；从理论上说；按道理；大体上；基本上
工作原理；经营理念；操作原理
原理；功之原理；工作原理
系统原理；系统的分析思考方法；系统原则

rootsaffixes.indicate: = first 第一 , 引申为“主要的”
rootsaffixes.title: prim, prin, pri

partsOfSpeech.dec: prim 第一，引申为“主要的” + e → 最初的；基本的
prim 第一，引申为“主要的” + acy 表性质 → 主要地位；重要性
prim 第一，引申为“主要的” + ary …的 → 最初的；根本的
prim 第一，引申为“主要的” + er 表物 → 第一本书 → 初级读本
prim 第一，引申为“主要的” + ev 时代 + al …的 → 最早的时代 → 远古的
prim 第一，引申为“主要的” + itive …的 → 原始的
primo〔= prim〕第一，引申为“主要的” + genit 产生 + or 表人 → 最早产生的人 → 始祖
prin 第一，引申为“主要的” + ce → 王位的第一继承人 → 王子
prin 第一，引申为“主要的” + cip 抓 + al 表人 → 作为第一〔要务〕来抓 → 最重要的
prin 第一，引申为“主要的” + cip 抓 + le 做某种动作时所使用的东西 → 握住主要〔原则〕→ 原则
pri 第一，引申为“主要的” + or 表状态 → 排在第一的 → 优先的
prior 优先（的）+ ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 先；优先权
